Reviews.Author: Candyce B.
Reviews.Content: I met a couple of girlfriends here for dinner and drinks on Friday evening. Parking was easy because the restaurant is attracted to a parking garage and...yes! They do validate parking. We started in the bar area, which was pretty crowded. We were hoping to grab a table but quickly found out they take reservations at those tables so we were moved to the main dining area once everyone arrived. The bartenders were awesome! With so many beers on tap, I had no clue which to try first! So she let me sample some of her favorites and I found that the Kolsch was a winner!! It was light and refreshing and a perfect compliment to our appetizers. We ordered the Brewery chicken nachos and Southwest egg rolls, both were delicious! The nachos come with an entire dish of freshly made salsa and the they load you up on the toppings: cheese, sour cream,black beans, chicken, onions, jalapeños and guacamole. The egg rolls are deep fried and stuffed with chicken, beans, red peppers, zucchini, tomatoes, corn and pepper jack cheese! Yum. For dinner I went with the Southwest Turkey burger. The turkey burger is mixed with peppers and onions which adds a really nice flavor to the meat! They then top it with lettuce tomato, avocado mayo, fried peppers, sliced avocado and pepper jack cheese. I really enjoyed it! The fries weren't my favorite...they were shoe string cut and a bit too crunchy but at least they came out hot! All in all, I'd definitely return and recommend a visit to anyone!

Reviews.Author: Kelly M.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch on Memorial Day. They have an outside seating area that is covered which was a huge plus and it is located really close to 7th Street Market. I tried a flight of their beers and they were decent but nothing special. I would recommend the red ale or the double IPA. We had their nachos to start which were ok, it is a huge serving that comes with salsa to dip. I had the veggie tacos which were good, they had a crunchy shell covered with a soft tortilla which I actually enjoyed. It came with a side of rice and beans. I really liked the black beans but there was something about the rice that had a bad after taste. My husband ordered the veggie burger and fries. I tried the fries and I liked them but didn't try his burger. He said it was good but again nothing special.

Reviews.Author: Jake B.
Reviews.Content: Went last night with in-laws for mother in laws bday.We always have loved the place and it is our go to place when we have something to celebrate and even when we don't.  Walked right in, we're seated, server was pleasant. Mentioned it was for mother in laws birthday and she was nice about it.Ordered drinks and an appetizer. ..This is where things went slightly pear shaped. Server came back and told us the appetizer was delayed. No big beal, things happen. Food comes and as always, was completely wonderful. Chicken fried chicken for three of us and my wife had the sizzling peppers. More pear shaped, waitress was no where to be found for 20 minutes. Wife was out of beer and spicy food minus drink.....she waited. Finally I got up and had to get another server to get a refill. She started with "I am not your server...." but said she would take care of it. To her credit she did. Manager comes over, very nice, apologized for the appetizer and days she will cover it. Server shows up and is rather standoffish. Not rude per se but moody. Not sure if it was my stunt with the beer or the manager but either way not our fault. More waiting for desert, more drinks, something and then the server does show up with the bill no questions asked, not a thing.The rating is not for the appetizer,  like I said things happen. It was not for the lack of drinks, it was for the apathy. At least come by and check on us, tell us the app is coming, but the server seemed to say, "the app screwed my tip so why try". If the place was hopping I would get it, but it was early afternoon. Anyway long story short: great food, apathetic service, use to be a go to place even with the hour drive but we may be finding another one.

Reviews.Author: Kate T.
Reviews.Content: After two recent visits here, I can honestly say I am torn on my review, but overall I know I have had better. Most recently, we arrived shortly after 12 and were seated indoors, because the patio was full, and it took our server over 15 minutes to take our drink order. We started off with the spinach artichoke dip and chips, which arrived 5 minutes before our food. Before I get to the food, the appetizer was cold and came with about 10 chips. Being there were four of us we asked for some extra chips and some salsa. The chips were warm, however the salsa, stay away, unless you like Pace's from the grocery store. Really, are they kidding serving store bought salsa???On to the food.  We ordered a good variety, stuffed peppers, chicken enchiladas, burger and chicken sandwich. The chicken sandwich was burnt and you cook smell the burn! The enchiladas and peppers were so spicy we had to ask for more water. Only positive, the fries, great seasoning!As for the service, I wish I took her name, but our waitress could have given two sh...about being there and you could tell. No refills, never saw her, except our order and bill, and very blah! Not sure we would return anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Marie S.
Reviews.Content: I am never disappointed with their beer, food , or service. I have visited Chicago and Long Beach and now Charlotte always great and consistent.

Reviews.Author: Tasha C.
Reviews.Content: This place has a mixed Menu..I had the 2am Burger which was very delicious and I was extremely full afterwards.  It had Bacon, hashbrown and a fried Egg for the topping. ..hence the name 2am. My Mom had the Fish and chips which were also tasty.  The sauce that came with it I could of skipped. The Fries are regular shoestring fries and nothing spectacular. They do bring Malt Vinegar to the table to doctor them up. We watched the World Cup game so it was a bit busy however our food was out in 15 minutes and yes the fries were hot!.  The waiter was helpful with the menu items and very pleasant.  I will definitely be going back to try the Stuffed Peppers which came highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Corey Tess T.
Reviews.Content: Beer - Many choices and micro-brews (I dont drink beer, but if you do, there is lots here)Salads - MehBurgers - GoodWine - MehCoffee - MehSoup - So/soTex-Mexish dishes - were actually okStuffed bell peppers - actually quite goodThis isn't my kind of place, but we stop in for lunch now and then because it's downstairs from where we work. When you walk by outside, the smell of the brewing is so strong!I say A-OK, because it's not my style, but it is a good micro-brewery with burgers, fries etc. The stuff you expect. Lots of seating and service is A-Ok. They have a nice patio as well.

Reviews.Author: Daniel M.
Reviews.Content: This place wasn't bad.  If you live in Charlotte and have tried the other local beers in the area, check this place out.  If you're from out of town and want good local beer, I'd recommend somewhere else.  While the beer was good, it wasn't memorable.  The food was good, but again, nothing super memorable.  The waitress was friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Nicole W.
Reviews.Content: Average bar food, nothing to write home about. Corn tortillas average salad. Average...just average. Go support a local place that offers something different

Reviews.Author: Kaleena C.
Reviews.Content: FiNALLY! A restaurant in Charlotte that makes up for all the bad ones. Their burgers are to die for. BEST BURGER IN CHARLOTTE! I had the Bacon Mac N Cheese which was really good but wow...my husband had the bourbonzola burger and it was delicious. The appetizers are good too plus if you go to the Blumenthal Center for the Performing Arts and take your show ticket you get a free appetizer!This is one of my new favorite places! Thank you, Rock Bottom, for restoring my faith in Charlotte restaurants!

Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: I had the 2AM burger and it may have honestly been the best burger I've ever had! I also love their patio seating outside and the bar around the back. My only complaint (which isn't Rock Bottom's fault) is that homeless people approached our table 3 times during our dinner to ask for either money or some of our water.

Reviews.Author: B T.
Reviews.Content: I have been to several Rock Bottoms including Denver, CO and this one was less than impressive. I'm new to Charlotte so I've been waiting to try this Rock Bottom out.  Went on a Sunday afternoon around 5pm. I took my young son with me so it was just dinner no alcohol. The restaurant wasn't very busy so we got seated right away.  Our server (which I didn't get his name) appeared about 5 minutes after we got seated, got our drinks and then we ordered.  We didn't see him again until after our food was brought to us. We only saw him twice after he checked to see if we had our food, and one of those two times was to hand us the check. The food was so-so.  My son had a hamburger which was delicious - my chicken bruschetta was fair but cold and the broccoli had no butter, seasoning, nothing.  It was over priced for what the meal consisted of. I gave two stars because  I was disappointed mainly with the service more so than the food. I've never had bad service or a bad meal at the Rock Bottoms I've been to in the past so was expecting the same high standards that I'm used to.  Might try again, but it will be a while.

Reviews.Author: Kim M.
Reviews.Content: We went for lunch on Sunday Afternoon.  We sat there for ten minutes and nobody acknowledged us or came to our table.  A waitress passed our table two times and chose not to make eye contact with us.  Servers congregated at the hostess stand.  We walked out and still nobody noticed.  This used to be my favorite place uptown.  Really disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Monica W.
Reviews.Content: Went here for a bachelorette party of 12 girls, we had a reservation, waited 10 minutes to be seated, was seated a four different tables that we had to asked be pushed together.  We then sat at least 15 minutes before we were greater and our drink order was taken, but the drinks took almost 25 minutes before arriving.  When our drinks did arrive, the server ran off before taking our dinner order, more time passes... we order and our food comes out pretty reasonably ~15-20 minutes.  When the food did come out three orders were missing completely, our server did not bring our food and was nowhere to be found, we sat waiting until finally she came by.  At this point we've been here well over an hour.  The manager comes by, gets the food out, says that there would be a free round of drinks for the whole table.  I didn't receive the drink promised by the manager and when I asked the server I got a look, this was the first and only time I asked her about anything!?  She brought the drink as I was returning from the restroom and said that an entire bottle of wine would be brought out due to the issues, we explained that we had other commitments that it wasn't necessary.  Then the manager threw in two bottles of champagne, at this point, I'm pretty sure he knew that nobody had a great experience and was trying to save face.  In the end, the manager was great at covering up for the lack of service we received but with so many options in downtown Charlotte I would chose another place next time.

Reviews.Author: Sean M.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here last weekend, it was really good.  We were just going to sit at the bar and have a drink but someone ordered pizza next to us and it looked awesome.  We ordered a pizza and new people sitting next to us started asking us about the pizza.  The food was good, the bar tenders were nice and the beer was good.  We will be back.

Reviews.Author: Debby M.
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I took my son out for dinner and we all LOVED it!  My husband had the bacon mac and cheese. He said it was the best he had ever eaten!  My son at the veggie tacos and also loved them.  I had one of there salads and was very happy with what I received.  Our server went out of his way to make sure everything was the way we wanted it.  Looking forward to going back soon!

Reviews.Author: Shariah P.
Reviews.Content: The food was rock bottom. It was so disappointing that  me and two my friends could not finish our meals.

Reviews.Author: Capri K.
Reviews.Content: My husband loves this place so whenever we are in town we tend to stop by.  I really enjoy the atmosphere!  It's a great place to meet friends, have a family meal, or for date night.  I personally love the mixed drinks.  I have yet to hit a home run with their handcrafted beers but I will keep trying- I truly believe they have one for me on that menu somewhere!  Upon a recent visit I tried the Winter Tartan Scottish Ale but it was just a little too bitter for my tastes.  The food is a different story.  I haven't had anything that was really memorable.  There was an awesome crab dip at one point but when I tried something similar on my latest visit, it was not the same taste.  Regardless of the food, we ALWAYS have a good time!

Reviews.Author: JLeigh S.
Reviews.Content: Overall: Great food, great service, great location, great restaurantI have been a Rock Bottom fan since my college years at UNCC (2001).  Now, after the fabulous service that we receive at our wedding rehearsal dinner, I know why this place has stayed in business for so long while so many other venues in the area have turned over ownership or simply closed.  Simply put, our night was incredible.  Kate and the Rock Bottom staff went above and beyond to ensure that we had everything we needed and the service did not falter the entire night.When looking for a spot to host our wedding rehearsal dinner, we were looking for a nice, casual place in the downtown area with great food and within a reasonable budget.  I inquired at over a dozen restaurants and not one compared to the serviced offered by Rock Bottom.  Most had high food and beverage minimums, high per person dinner prices, limited menu options (for the price) or simply did not call me back.  Furthermore, many of the venues that I inquired at have reasonable priced menu options on a normal night, so the high prices didn't add up.  Considering that we were planning a lavish reception (and my mother-in-law paid for the meal and gave us a strict budget), we wanted to biggest bang for our buck.  So, in the end, I came back to my college favorite - Rock Bottom.We arrived to an impressively set outside patio.  The normal patio chairs were replaced with sturdy inside restaurant chairs and the tables were adorned with white table cloths and candles.  We were provided with our own outside bar and we opted for consumption-based drink selections.  All guests drink orders were promptly taken and to my knowledge, all were fulfilled.We selected a buffet-style dinner, which included a salad.  I was surprised when the salad was served plated, with our choice of dressing.  As I anticipated, the food was fresh, hot and excellent.Lastly, we planned on presenting a slide show to honor our friends, family and the bridal party.  So during the two months prior to the wedding, I paged through our childhood photo albums and searched through digital photo files to select the most meaningful, funny and special photos to include in the 14-minute presentation.  I lined up a projector, screen, speaker and thumb drive back up in hopes of eliminated any technical malfunction but failed to consider that my dated 2006 Dell computer would incompatible with the 2013 projector.  Realizing how important the slide show was to me, my fiancé and the Rock Bottom Staff exhaustively troubleshooted and resolved the issues to ensure my show was played.  All without an interruption of service to the rest of our guests.Overall, the Rock Bottom staff went over and above their hosting requirements to create a perfect evening for us and our guests.  Our rehearsal evening was the perfect kick off to our wedding weekend.  Thank you!!

Reviews.Author: Christy M.
Reviews.Content: Great food & craft beer.My husband is a craft beer guy and he loved the 6 he tried. I went for the food, had the Veggie Burger which had black beans and was amazing! Had the tomato soup as well, interesting, but also good. ONE negative, though- NO WHOLE WHEAT BUNS?! What restaurant doesn't have whole wheat bread alternatives these days?!

Reviews.Author: Amanda V.
Reviews.Content: Took my husband here and we simply had stellar service, amazing food and wonderfully crafted beers.  The staff went over and beyond to interact with us, including the bartender who was behind the bar with two tables in between where we were sitting. There was even some sort of traveling sports school event there with around 75 or more college students ordering at the same time as us, the place was extremely busy in all areas yet there wasn't a server or tender without a smile on their face, or a personality shining through. I must say. We had one of the best experiences we have ever had out anywhere in NC there at rock bottom. We were having such a good time when we paid the check we ordered 2 more drinks because we didn't want to leave.   I would highly recommend this restaurant and the jalapeño poppers!

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: Visited Rock Bottom at about 4:45 on a Saturday.  Was surprised at how busy they were but we were still able to be seated quickly in a large comfortable booth overlooking the street.I started with the Summer Honey Ale.  Meh.  I think I was expecting a bit more of a sweet/honey flavor.  I wish I had tried one of their other beers.  It comes in a large glass (I think bigger than a typical pint serving).I had the stuffed poblano peppers.  I was curious (dubious?) so I asked my server.  She said that the filling is awesome and that the bites with the peppers had a kick.  She was spot on.  I really enjoyed the cheesey, chicken-y, chorizo-y filing.  The rice around the peppers was good too and it definitely seemed like a hearty portion.  Eventually, with sweat running down the side of my face, I scraped the remaining filling out of the second pepper and just ate it.  I enjoyed my pepper bites but was ready to stop the heat.Our group shared some of the ice cream sandwiches.  Childish?  Yes.  Tasty?  Surely.  The plate comes with three ice cream sandwiches made with chocolate chip cookies, some strawberries, and a bowl of chocolate sauce.  My only wish was that the cookies were a bit softer.  In texture and look, they were over done with just lent additional difficulty to eating the messy treat.Our server was very good and took excellent care of us.

Reviews.Author: Pool D.
Reviews.Content: first off, we walked in for a bigger table (6) and watched the manager, who didn't address us at ALL, make the host who had an injured arm put together 2 tables and rearrange the chairs without any help. The manager even made eye contact and still couldn't even say hello to us or the 2 people behind us waiting as well.  The server provided great service and the beer was good. The food was another story. The burgers were over done and the personal pizza was burnt on the bottom and missing cheese from a whole slice. I made pizzas in a deli for a few years and I must say I don't know how you can do that but there's a first time for everything. The house salad was 90 % white and 10 % green, weak! All in all the pizza got replaced and taken off the bill but was that enough to entice a return visit? Maybe for a beer.....

Reviews.Author: Jeremy S.
Reviews.Content: If I could design the perfect all-around restaurant, this would be it! Casual, but not too much. Wide range of food: from wings, to burgers, steaks, salads, fish tacos, and a ton more. New and clean inside, with an awesome bar area as well as private tables. I also love their outdoor seating, both the front and back sides. I've been coming here for almost ten years now, and still love it. The perfect neighborhood restaurant, whether you want a full steak dinner, or just wings and beer with friends.

Reviews.Author: Ashley S.
Reviews.Content: Their beers are really good, I just wish the food was that great too. I ordered the bacon chicken mac and cheese, which instantly got my mouth watering just thinking about it. I ate a little bit, but I didn't want to finish it. Way too much pepper or spices, and I could hardly taste the cheese. It would be better if they didn't label it as a mac and cheese, because it didn't taste like that at all to me. It came with a slice of french bread on the side, but it was plain. No butter on it or any on the side. Kinda weird.My sister raved about her hazelnut crusted chicken, but I wasn't too impressed by that either. I ended up just drinking my dinner, which is just fine by me! :)

Reviews.Author: Sally M.
Reviews.Content: Great lunch!  Sat at the bar - busy spot - they have lots of take out orders.Bartender do an ok job keeping up.Salad was delish!  A little too much arugula , so I removed some and it was better.Will look forward to coming back next visit to Charlotte

Reviews.Author: Grace A.
Reviews.Content: I never go uptown just to eat here, but if I'm already uptown I come here frequently.Their beer is OK and they have all of the bases covered to suit beer tastes.Their menu covers many styles.  I had the shrimp enchiladas the other day and it really hit the spot.I've been here with groups and have received good service and the checks have always been accurate and the food is always served with a smile.Parking is convenient in the lot right below and they validate.

Reviews.Author: Sandy P.
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous time sitting at the bar on a busy Saturday. Meredith is an incredibly attentive bartender, regardless of her busy surroundings. Great beer. The food was pretty rockin'! Get the Mac and cheese!

Reviews.Author: Sumito A.
Reviews.Content: Get to the Chase:Pros:1) Fantastic ribs! Succulent, juicy, and came right off the bone2) Exceptional service (I think I saw our waitress spend half the time on her hands and knees wiping off crumbs and food that other customers left under their table)...I have never seen a restaurant where that happened...not only that she was always genuinely smiling and making sure we had fresh water3) Fantastic beer selections (would highly recommend the beer sampler)4) First time I actually LOVED coleslaw...perfect balance of slaw, mayo, and tangy sweetness (accented by the freshly cut slivers of apple)5) Desserts do equal justice to their delicious entreesCons:1) None

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: Good service and great food. Only draw back was no fault of restaurant. We were seated next to some screaming children. But the restaurant found us better seating.

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were part of a friend's birthday party of about 12 adults on a Thursday night. It was not especially crowded (no wait) and we had reservations.1. Nobody took our drink orders or brought us water for over 20minutes.2. When they brought out all the appetizers, ours was not among them, because it was never put in. When it finally came out, it was clear the nachos were rushed and they were not especially good.3. When the entree came out, we were brought the incorrect dish, at this point I had more than enough of the place, so I told them to forget about it and bring the check.4. Everyone had finished their meals for nearly an hour before the checks were sporadically brought out. After all the checks were brought out, we had to pull the waitress aside and specifically ask for her to bring ours.5. During this whole time, there was no one who looked like a manager to be found. Everyone at the table was clearly upset by the service, yet management never showed its face.This was, by far, the worst dining experience I have ever been a part of and I would not recommend this overrated establishment to anyone.

Reviews.Author: Robert T.
Reviews.Content: Yummy! 6 of us ventured into this Uptown Charlotte restaurant around 6:30 and I was a little worried that it wasn't very crowded for a Friday night.  We were able to get a table right away....... And lucky for us....... everyone of us LOVED our dish. I had the Fish and Chips which were made from fresh Haddock perfectly battered and fried.  It was served with an excellent Apple Slaw that awakened the senses in my mouth. The Commissioner loved his drink and my glass of wine was hearty and full bodied. His dinner was an excellent adult version of Mac and Cheese with Bacon and Chicken.As we were leaving the place was starting to get busier and busier. So stop in if you are in the neighborhood.  Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Author: Phillip S.
Reviews.Content: A cool place to hang out in downtown.  The food.is very good.  You cannot go wrong with the fish and chips.  I enjoy the beer.  Most of beers are brewed on site.  The only problem is the staff turns over very quickly.  Parking is free if you park in the deck under the restaurant.   Make sure yo ger your ticket validated.   Sign up for the rewards card.  It is not nearly as good as the previous perks card, but it can be uses nationally.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth C.
Reviews.Content: I went to Rock Bottom with a few of my friends and i will say for a restaurant and micro-brewery my Long Island Iced Tea was sufficiently strong and was quite a treat. We were seated quickly for a Saturday night with no reservation and there didn't seem to be much of a wait, unless you had a larger group of people. We tried to call for a larger group previous to this date and there apparently is a cutoff time for calling ahead for larger groups.Our service was very good and easy on the eyes which is always a pleasant factor when dining, considering the people who can be spotted in various North Carolina locales. Our food was fresh and nicely seasoned. I had the jambalaya which had a good amount of spiciness for a creole type dish. On the menu there were various other choices like macaroni and cheese, vegetables, pretzels for appetizers, etc. I will return to Rock Bottom for both food and for drinks, hopefully catching a large table before they are all taken up.

Reviews.Author: Bruce K.
Reviews.Content: Oh man oh man! Another review, and this time from the well known Rock Bottom in downtown Charlotte. I came here with a friend who wanted some of their beer as well as their food. And sadly, I wasn't impressed. Inside though they completely changed the outlay of the dining area from the last time I came here, which was about 2 years ago... They added ramps as well as new things to look at and admire, such as the glass between booths and some paintings. But, overall it's all the same with the looks and what not.I had two things from the menu: Fish Tacos (RB Taco) and the Southwestern Chili.Now, the good first. Southwestern Chili. It was awesome, I felt like it was very good and chunky. However, I wish the portion was just a wee bit bigger just because it was so tasty!Another plus was the service. My friend ordered a steak and it was a little overcooked, the waiter completely understood and took it back to get another steak cooked medium rare. It was fast and I believe even the manager came up to fix the problem. They offered a soup or whatever, but my friend declined (I was wondering why he didn't get me another chili!)Now the bad. Eating the Fish Tacos was like grabbing a handful of seasoned salt and then eating it. Every single bite was just a burst of not just salt, but just sodium with a little heat kicked in, but that was probably from the amount of salt and it made it seem spicier. After drinking water, it was still stuck in my mouth. Kick back the salt Rock Bottom and pull out that flavor of the fish! After all, it is a fish taco.Overall, not bad, food is average. Service is pretty good though. Next time though, I'm sticking away from those tacos.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: We came on a Thursday and ordered the beer sampler and Southwest egg rolls. - Happy hour extended! Great Waitress! It ended at 630 but she was kind enough to let it slide. - Egg rolls taste more like a flauta. - Sample 6 beers. 3rd one is too hoppy. 1st and last are the best. good deal for $7. - Lots of TVs. Big party friendly.- Just like SD and SJ.

Reviews.Author: Aubrey F.
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason this place gets two stars and not one is because our server was fantastic: he split our bills no problem, didn't screw up water orders, put up with a colleague's silly antics, and got our food to us promptly. The food was bad, yo. Like, below Applebee's bad. We split an order of guacamole. For $8.50, you get a tiny dish of it and a bunch of chips in a little bucket. What a crock. The guacamole was fine, but for $8.95, you can go to Vida over at Epicenter and get (as I wrote in a previous review) a veritable fuck-ton of it prepared tableside.I also ordered the Southwestern Turkey burger. It sounded delightful - peppers mixed in with the meat, jack cheese, fried jalepeños - but tasted like garbage. The meat was tasteless but spicy, the jalepeños were in five tiny bits on top of the burger, the cheese was like plastic. The bun was overly bread-y. I ordered with a side of fruit, which was disappointingly not fresh.My colleagues complained that their food sucked too: overly dry burger for $10 and a dried out piece of salmon for $18.50. What the fuck.People, don't go here unless you want to get ripped off and eat shitty food.

Reviews.Author: LJ W.
Reviews.Content: As I work in the immediate vicinity of Rock Bottom's, I dine (or take out) there at least once a week. The food there is glorified over priced bar food. It is almost impossible to spend under $10 for lunch there.That said, the sandwiches are reasonably good, as are the fries. Some rave about their mac & cheese, but I wasn't impressed. Gluey and tasteless.I've had to send back burgers on more than one occasion to get it to the ordered temperature. I do like their chicken sandwiches a lot. A nice sized portion with tasty options. The salads are also quite good, but too big. I'd be happy to pay half price for half the salad.Overall, good, not great.

Reviews.Author: Sara K.
Reviews.Content: Food was good, a bit overpriced for the quality / selection. They have a make your own pizza for the kids which is great and provides some entertainment. I recommend ordering it first thing though bc it does delay the rest of the order while they make it. Would go back but would like to try some non-chains in the area too. Very close to discovery place which was nice as we only had to walk a block for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth C.
Reviews.Content: During a visit to the queen city, I came across Rock Bottom when looking for a place to watch college football on a Saturday afternoon. I sat at the bar and was greeted by an excellent bar tender (whose name I cannot recall) and she walked me through the beer selections for the day. I think I'm getting old, because I can't remember what beer I ordered with my meal. I do remember that whatever it was it went well with my baby brats (I think there were an Oktoberfest menu item) and ahi tuna salad. Both dishes were very good and I'm definitely ordering the brats again when I visit the restaurant on another occasion.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy D.
Reviews.Content: Rock Bottom probably has one of the best locations in uptown. Right on Tryon St. with a large dining area and excellent patio for people watching or watching the cars go by.I don't remember what I ordered I think it was some sort of BBQ chicken and ribs. The food was pretty average, I didn't get to try the beer but I hear it's quite excellent. It's not that the food is bad, in fact I quite enjoyed my time here, but the selections available and food that came out were just not quite memorable. Maybe I would even call it boring.I'd come just for the great atmosphere here. When you go to the bathroom you can see all the behind the scenes brewing behind a large glass window! The parking is free too which is nice, more to spend on food!

Reviews.Author: Leoj N.
Reviews.Content: It's rock bottom, you know what you're gonna get. We have this in DC and San Diego. Friends kids loved the pizza and fruit cup. Most even stayed on the table and not on the floor. this was a major accomplishment.  The milk and apple juice must have tasted great as well as they both had refills.I had the Hawaiian Chicken which was really tasty, pineapple, rice pilaf and green beans.  Next time maybe something not "chainy", but this did hit the spot. no wait at around 7pm on a Monday. outdoor seating too - a+

Reviews.Author: Bruce K.
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located at the top of the Blue Line, just a short block and half over to Tryon, you can't miss the Rock Bottom facade. I was meeting a friend for a semi-business lunch, so I wasn't able to try any of their house brewed beers (they server Kaliber, but they don't have their own non-alcoholic beer). The back of their lunch menu is all booze - 11 different martinis and 4 different margaritas and a whole bunch more. Definitely a full bar here!I had read over the previous Yelpers before going, so I had one of their salads - the Goat Cheese and Hummus. It was a huge scoop of hummus (at least a cup, maybe more) with a dressing tossed salad on top of sliced flatbreads. Way too much food, the hummus was sharp and tasty with just enough garlic that it was delicious but not so much that I was worried about my breath heading back to the office. Maybe there could have been more goat cheese, but that's just me complaining because it was good!My friend had some sort of cheese topped grilled chicken with fries. While it was good, I absolutely won the competition. ;-)A very pleasant experience. I'd have no problem going back here if I'm Uptown.

Reviews.Author: Jenni A.
Reviews.Content: Visiting from out of town we happen to walk upon this place. The food was good and the service was great. The menu itself has a lot for everyone. We did sample the beer it was good just a bit warm for my taste.

Reviews.Author: Shanda B.
Reviews.Content: We were ivisiting from out of town and went here on a Friday night.  We had good service and great food.  We both had the chicken/sausage gumbo and it had just a little kick to warm us up on a chilly night.  Also went for the beer battered fish and chips which was also great.

Reviews.Author: Chunnu B.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good, not bad, but nothing I would crave or get excited about so, a solid 3 stars in my book. Friendly service and seemed like a good place for huge groups (there's no way any one there could have missed the giant family reunion here where everyone wore the exact same patterned clothing in shirt or dress form!) Food was good, pretty good pizza (too thin and floppy for me), jambalaya was pretty good, spicy, and was made with orzo pasta. Parking didn't seem like too much of a pain, there was a lot across the street and a garage attached to the building. Overall, it was pretty alright.

Reviews.Author: Amy C.
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had dinner at Rock Bottom on a Saturday evening prior to attending an event at Spirit Square.  The bright red signage makes it easy to spot (we parked at the 7th St garage and it was a short walk).  Surprisingly when we arrived at 5:45, there was already a 30 minute wait (Bobcats game, Panthers game tomorrow, a few other "events" in addition to the small venue concert that we were going to were going on).  But true to what the hostess said, exactly 30 minutes later our buzzer buzzed.  Lovely restaurant, although very dark.  And when walking to the restroom, I though I was being led out into an alley, it's a hike.  Wide selection of menu items, it was hard to decide what to get.  Comfy seating. We decided on the Jalapeno Spinach Cheese Dip which is served with tortillas to start with.  It was DELICIOUS.  Creamy and cheesy, the tortilla chips held up to dipping without breaking and they weren't overly salted.  The dip had a little bit of a kick to it without being overwhelming.  Very good start.I ordered the 2:00 am burger, which is a burger topped with a fried egg, cheese and bacon, with a hashbrown underneath and mac n' cheese as a side (mac n' cheese is an upgrade from the fries side, so you'll be charged a buck for this - it says it clearly on the menu, so no big...).  The burger was meh - not bad by any means, but lacking flavor.  I ended up asking for some ketchup to try and do something to it.  The bun held up well to all of the toppings though, so I didn't even up with a soggy mess on my plate that I would need to eat with a knife and fork, so points for that.  The mac n' cheese was very good.  Nothing fancy, but well done.  The food was more of a 3.5, but our waitress was amazing, great service even with a packed house, so I will go with a 4.  If another Spirit Square event comes up, I would definitely eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Stephen K.
Reviews.Content: Easy to enjoy and easy to forget.Rock Bottom is fine but not exceptional; the nachos are tasty, but isn't that true everywhere? I seem to remember a nice fish taco, but it might have been a black bean burrito. That's the sort of food you'll get. Enjoyable, but forgettable. This place's real appeal is a social one. Its outdoor seating is some of the best in Charlotte: in front you're on a busy street corner, perfect for people watching, and in back is a quieter courtyard. The interior is big and comfortable, so you'll want to linger and you'll never feel rushed. Bring good friends, and enjoy the beer.Which brings us to their status as a brewery. Supposedly they brew a host of award winning beers on the premises, but nothing I have tasted has been exceptional. I suspect that in this regard, breweries are like car companies - there are more than enough awards to go around and even the most mediocre beers will win something. Or maybe I just don't appreciate good beer.

Reviews.Author: Kieran M.
Reviews.Content: Location hurts this place. It's fun to sit outside and watch what North Tryon has to offer the first couple times going here, but it loses its luster. No complaints, but nothing stands out here.

Reviews.Author: Casandra G.
Reviews.Content: You definitely don't want for choices with the Rock Bottom menu.  They cover all sorts of ground in the American/Tex-Mex/Americanized Ethnic food types.  But of course, most places with big menus have lots of food that is between pretty good and pretty mediocre.  I had an okay bowl of chili, my guest had a chicken pot pie  that she did not care for.  Burgers and sandwiches are solid.  We all loved the excellent, addictive fries: they're the thin snacky types full of potatoey flavor.Oh man and I tried the seasonal beer - a bock - which was a pretty good deal.  We figured that it was 25% more beer than the standard serving but at only 12.5% higher cost.  Anyway the brew was a knockout.  Don't drink it on an empty stomach, but do drink it.

Reviews.Author: Terrell L.
Reviews.Content: Great location downtown Charlotte, nice menu and wonderful Hand Crafted Beer Selection.Sports bar atmosphere with quite a few TV's located around and a few Pool Tables too.

Reviews.Author: Brian A.
Reviews.Content: A disappointing experience! I have been to Rock Bottom several times before this trip. The pizza always seemed decent and the microbrews were okay too. Nothing special, but the location and atmosphere has always been nice.The insert menu excited me when I got here...Oktoberfest...was here. I love German food and I love Oktoberfest beers. I mean...love...really love Oktoberfest beers. The German Burger: half a pound of meat with some cabbage, mushrooms, Swiss, and ketchup....on a fresh pretzel bun. Sounds great, right? Wrong! It tasted like a big meat patty...no flavor...nothing! Just plain boring.The Oktoberfest Sampler Platter: Some type of "Knackwurst" corndog...which tasted pretty much like Pronto Pups at any northern state fair...not bad...but not warm in the middle. The fried corned beef and cabbage things were nice...but seemed pretty Irish to me. This also came with a fresh Bavarian pretzel with a variety of mustards...nice.Now here we go! Rock Bottom describes their Oktoberfest beer as Full-bodied with a classic sweet flavor, Rocktoberfest is an award-winning Oktoberfest-style beer that is rich with a toasted malt character and finishes with a subtle crisp hop.Now...if I was allowed to swear here...I would. In what world this beer is toasty, malty, finishing a tad hoppy...or award winning is beyond me. This beer is Budweiser with some caramel food coloring. This beer had no personality whatsoever! I can say that it finished nicely...by having no taste at all. Great job! I'm glad a terribly sub-par meal only set me back sixty bucks...I'd probably need a second job if I decided to eat somewhere with good food.

Reviews.Author: Michelle W.
Reviews.Content: 2 word review: sub par.more-than-2-word review: good location if you're in uptown, lots of seating, decent service. The food, however, is pretty bleh. Everything I had was bland with the culinary prowess of a microwave burrito. Crab and artichoke dip was runny, like hot yogurt with the same about of flavor as crab meat (...so, not much). I got the margarita pizza which was edible but that's the only redeeming quality I can give it. I was with a group of a dozen or so and everyone's summary of their food seemed to be "meh".Basically, if you like Applebee's... you should come to this place and pay more for the same food.

Reviews.Author: Amanda F.
Reviews.Content: I've visited Rock Bottom a few times over the last couple months, courtesy of a gift card =)They have really stepped up their game! I was always a fan, but I like it even more now. They remodeled and it has a better -- more upscale, modern, but not pretentious -- vibe now. Service (at the bar) has always been great!They brew their own beer (and have local charlotte brews on their guest taps), both of the recent Seasonal Brews I tried were great - most recently Rocktoberfest. And you can always get a sampler if you feel torn. Their menu selection is huge and has something for everyone. This weekend I tried the grilled chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies - yumm! Next time, I'm eyeing the chicken fried chicken, ooo yeah. The only not-so-nice thing I have to say is, skip the pretzels. You can do much better at other places in charlotte. Other than that, I really like this place and I'm sure we'll be back!P.S. They validate parking for the attached garage!

Reviews.Author: Jon L.
Reviews.Content: This is a great  stop for a meal if your going to a Bobcat's game or any event at Time Warner arena.They have covered garage parking for just $5 and a menu that just won't quit. They've got something for everyone.Try the Mahi tacos, two fresh and flavorful,  crispy tacos, covered with a soft flour tortilla...the flavor screams at you...!If it's busy, you can get a game of pool on the two billiard tables or sit at the bar and enjoy on of the many big screen plasmas. It's a five mimute walk to the Bobcat's and the Blue Line Lynx with easy access stop to Panthers.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth F.
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Their menu is HUGE - which can be a good and bad thing. Good if you know what you want. Bad if you're totally indecisive like me. =) There is such a big variety, you will definitely find something you like and if you don't you're not human. Luckily, I had a friend recommend the fish tacos so I went with that. It was a hard taco wrapped in a soft taco with melted pepper jack cheese, and all the regular taco garnishes. Was fantastic. A little on the spicy side for me, but I'm truly a baby when it comes to that so don't go by my spicy judgment. Also, I want to add that the server was extremely nice by letting me only get the tacos. I didn't want the extra rice & beans so she took a couple dollars of the meal price and just gave me the tacos. Obviously Rock Bottom is known for their beers and they definitely had a great selection to offer. I tried a few =) but ended up really liking the Brown Ale the best. They were packed when we went but we didn't have to wait too long for our food and our service was on point! Clean place too. Would definitely hit up this place if I'm ever back in Charlotte again. =) Go try it!.

Reviews.Author: Cathy B.
Reviews.Content: Rock Bottom Brewery has a great location and huge space, including bar area and indoor/outdoor seating. I've been a few times for lunch during the week and twice for dinner. It gets pretty busy at lunch time so try to arrive a little before noon or around 12:45pm in order to beat the lunch crowd rush. I've not had a problem getting a seat for dinner. And I've always had great service. The menu is huge (literally) with tons to choose from in terms of beverages and food. The fish tacos are good and the chicken picatta was okay but I found myself scraping off the extra sauce, and the green beans that came with it were overdone and soggy. I did enjoy the french fries. Where Rock Bottom falls slightly short is the prices. They're frankly too high for this type of establishment (in my mind it's similar to Applebee's or Outback). And as always, parking is a little tough uptown. Ultimately, if you're looking for somewhere to go and the other uptown restaurants are packed, Rock Bottom is a solid choice. Just don't expect to be overwhelmed.

Reviews.Author: Sasha R.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars.  Nothing special, but everything was fairly well done.  Went for a lunch meeting and had the southwest salad.  The jalapeno ranch was made in house and was great.  The baguette on the side was a nice touch.  Service was perfect: attentive but not hovering.  We were able to get in and out quickly.  Other diner thought the ahi tuna salad was good as well.  Tuna was perfectly done and contained a good sized lunch portion.  Other meals (chicken avocado sandwich and bacon cheeseburger) looked uninteresting.

Reviews.Author: Eric K.
Reviews.Content: I like Rock Bottom.  It's in a great location Uptown and offers a good American menu in a nice, casual setting.  I can always count on great food and great service.   If you want a "light" meal, they have an abundance of salads to choose from.  I'm working my way through each of them, but I haven't had a disappointing one yet and they're each very filling.  If I'm a little hungrier or craving a hot meal, I tend to go with the Blue Crab Stuffed Chicken or the Hazelnut Crusted Chicken.  Mmm... they're both melt-in-your-mouth good.  Then I usually wash them down with whatever brewed-on-the-spot beer they have on special, preferably something light.  Rock Bottom is a good place to take eaters that don't like to experiment with gourmet food (but you can still find something gourmetish yourself!), out-of-town guests, or even a date for a nice, casual get-to-know-you meal in nice surroundings without any pretension.  It can even serve as a great standby if everything else Uptown is too crowded or you can't decide where to eat.  You'll never be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Paul C.
Reviews.Content: Went here for a pre-show meal. We were looking forward to the beers, and fortunately or unfortunately (depending upon your viewpoint), that was the highlight of the meal. I ordered the ribs, which were dry and not that hot. Also they were not that tender. Their sweet sauce, however, was good, but no sauce can make up for poorly cooked ribs. My wife had the chicken pesto pasta. While that was decent, it wasn't exciting either.Sure, the plates were "sizeable." But PRICEY for what you get. I mean, we could have gone to Aria Italian nearby and gotten a MUCH better quality of food for LESS than this place! I mean, we went here thinking we would get a good value. Unfortunately, it's more than a lot of other comparable places in Uptown.Too many other choices in Charlotte to come back here.

Reviews.Author: Seth A.
Reviews.Content: Rock Bottom Brewery is decent bet for food and drinks in Uptown.  While I haven't had a bad dish or poor service, Rock Bottom seems to be a variation on a theme: a classy Americana pub with dressed up pub fare and dark paneling.  I agree with Stephen K.'s summary of Rock Bottom but there are some highlights to the menu.  I've had a pretty awesome quesadilla and enchiladas to the tune of $12-14 and a hearty pick-your-own toppings cheeseburger.  I love carbs, so in this aspect, Rock Bottom does not dissapoint.  The chicken fingers are so-so.  However, the fries evoke memories of your middle school cafeteria (thin cut and taste like veggie oil).The staff are very friendly and professional; they actually make sure you're doing OK unlike wait staff at most sports bars.  I've never been treated rudely or indifferently here-I would vouch for the service any day.  What then, is the "selling point" of Rock Bottom.  Duh, location!  The outdoor seating gives view to a long stretch of Tryon St.  Rock Bottom is an awesome place to people-watch or grab a reasonable meal before launching an evening Uptown.  Rock Bottom is casual but not trashy, a pub that resorts to being a sports bar, and a stopping point but not a destination. If you've exhausted your rotation of Uptown restaurants and hangouts, at least add Rock Bottom to your list.

Reviews.Author: Joy S.
Reviews.Content: Better-than-average bar food with a great atmosphere. It's kind of a standard place to find yourself in nights out uptown...you won't expect to have your socks knocked off by anything, but you also won't have a bad time. It's spacious, too, so it's a great place to start the night off with a big group of friends. It's a decent place to bring kids as well...the menu is pretty diverse in terms of bar food, so it's good for families. My favorite part of this spot is the outdoor seating. You don't get a much better outdoor seating experience...you're right in the heart of uptown at one of the busiest intersections. It's fun to sit out there alone and just observe what happens. It's also a great venue for events. I attended a work-related party here, and the service was great. We all had a good time.

Reviews.Author: Tom S.
Reviews.Content: Stopped by here during a recent swing through Charlotte on biz. I was looking for an relaxed "Pub-food-plus" type of joint with good beer and in Rock Bottom, I found it. The bar staff was helpful and generous with samples from their 8ish original beers. The Brown Ale is delicious (and award winning) and my favorite of the group.While Rock Bottom features beer, they hang their hat on food. The nachos were loaded with fixin's, and the chili is chunky and decidedly above-average. It's a relaxed, inviting and warm destination for anyone looking for an afterwork drink or evening out.

Reviews.Author: Gerald M.
Reviews.Content: Decent food with a laid-back atmosphere. The burgers are very good, and the Brewer's Club is excellent (if you like focaccia). Stay away from the non-standard stuff like their Mexican or novelty sandwiches. I've been disappointed every time I tried to venture into that territory. The main dishes are generally pretty good, with my personal favorites being the Hazelnut Crusted Chicken and the Meatloaf. It's a great place to have lunch uptown. When the weather is nice you can sit on the patio and people watch. It's a safe place to bring non-adventurous lunch guests, as the food and atmosphere will have them feeling right at home.

Reviews.Author: Martha M.
Reviews.Content: While I am not much on chain restaurants, Rock Bottom is certainly a place we will be visting again.  My boyfriend and dining partner in crime is a huge beer lover.  Rock Bottom offered a great variety that he was pleased with and the brewery atmosphere is really cool.  The spirit and wine offerings were also pretty good with a solid variety of wines and the usual spirits (with some fun cocktail options).The menu is huge and offers enough to please anyone.  Our server was extremely sweet, quick, and very knowledgeable of the menu.  She passed the test when she offered solid beer recommendations with food pairings.  The food was surprisingly good.  We tried the southwest eggrolls to start (holy carbs and cheese) and then split a salad with flat bread pizza.  Once we finished dinner we moved to the bar...which I made a note on to visit for game days.  Spectacular set up with plenty of seating.  The gem of this place is actually the bartenders.  I'm sure that it's no surprise that if one sits at a bar, they are most likely going to chat with the bartenders.  These girls were hilarious and carried on great conversation with us without seeming imposing - which is the key to a great bartender.  We were enjoying the atmosphere so much we moved our evening plans to Rock Bottom and had friends meet us there.  Good food, great service, great drinks...we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany N.
Reviews.Content: I go here maybe once or twice a year since they have a BOGO coupon in the Citipass book but that's really the only thing enticing me to go. They have a nice patio area where you can sit back, relax, people watch and enjoy some humdrum food. Only complaint-random, crazy people screaming about Jesus and the noise from the Gold Rush and other CATS buses. Last time I went, our server was very sweet but it took almost 30 minutes for our lunch to make it out. I ordered a chicken sandwich and french fries-were they killing the chicken in the back?? I kept watching servers go by with other peoples food, practically salivating over the plates of french fries since I gave it up for Lent and just wanted one fry to make me happy. Thank God I didn't order their fish tacos (which I've heard are fantastic) because they probably would have had to go catch the fish to make it)I heard they validate parking which is a pretty nice touch if you don't live or work in the Uptown area. You have to park in the parking deck either below or on the side of RB.I like it for after work drinks as well but besides that, as Stephen K said, easy to enjoy and easy to forget.

Reviews.Author: Chad E.
Reviews.Content: Rock Bottom really is not the bottom.  They do have an incredible location, right on Tryon Street.  If the weather is right, then the patio is nice, but can be a bit of a pain because of the traffic.  Nothing quite like sucking down some exhaust while you are trying to enjoy your meal.  Still it is nicer than someplace that has nothing, and uptown really does not have that much traffic most nights.On the inside, the place borders on an upscale Applebees.  It is not that they are particularly nice or memorable, and that is the real issue here.  Because of the location and the opportunity, they have the potential to be so much more.The one bright spot is the service - Steve-o-reeno helped us out when we hit up the place for a night out with some friends, and he definitely made an average visit into a fully enjoyable one.  If he is around, make sure you ask for him.

Reviews.Author: Ian M.
Reviews.Content: Nothing here really blew me away..  Yeah, it's pretty cool that they brew their own beers and they are located on Tryon but... eh.  This spot is one step above an Applebees.  Dont get me wrong, I kinda like Applebees.  Just dont expect anything amazing.  I would suggest sitting outside and enjoying a nice day.  That might make it a little better.  I would also suggest you try the artichoke/crab dip.  That was rather delicious.  I would say, give it a try but know.. There are much better places in the city.  Enjoy!-Ian M.

Reviews.Author: Travis W.
Reviews.Content: Love the patio here, if it's nice out and you are a big fan of people watching (like me), then it's about as good as it gets.  The bar area is nice as well and spacious which is something sometimes overlooked by other establishments.  Give me room to drink and socialize!  Anyway, I've been here on multiple locations both dinner and lunches and never been disappointed at all.  They have a great selection of food (online menu is available), from shrimp and grits, to great sandwich's, steaks and seafood.  I will also tell you the service has never been bad, for me at least.  Always prompt and never lacking. Bottom line for Rock Bottom is......you can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Author: Trey S.
Reviews.Content: I went to the famed Rock Bottom the other night, Friday Dec. 2, 2011 to celebrate a good friend's birthday.  We ended up getting there around 7:45pm on a Friday night to find the place very alive with people, both young and old, carousing, socializing and being merry.  My friends and the party I was attending were stationed in the bar area, to the left as you walk in.  Though there was a jumble of people standing around drinking and talking, a server promptly noticed we were new to the scene and took our drink orders and provided us with a menu to look over.  I ordered a "light lager" for my girlfriend and a "Brown Ale" draft for myself.  Draft beers were running $4 per pint on Friday night; which certainly isn't bad, but isn't a deal by any means. As evening turned into a chilly night, the people I was with found a few tables in the bar area and placed food orders.  I ordered, the BBQ pulled pork sliders as an appetizer, and some sort of lobster and shrimp rolled into a black corn enchiladas.  As a devout BBQ lover, I found the sliders to be an extreme disappointment.  The BBQ was border-line cold and there was very little BBQ on each of the sliders.  As for the enchiladas, the appeal of my meal was more in the uniqueness of the dish than its actual taste.  It's not that the enchiladas were bad, they just left me wanting more.  My girlfriend got the steak with mashed-potatoes and green-beans.  I thought the steak was above par.  My girl friend said it was cooked to her specifications.  Overall, I felt the food was good not great, and the BBQ sliders were not up to BBQ code.  However, Rock Bottom offered the perfect ambiance to enjoy myself and my friend's birthday in splendid fashion.  The service WAS GREAT!  I wish I could recall my server's name, because I would love to give her a shot-out.  Despite the chaotic atmosphere that reigned throughout the bar, she was prompt, polite and accurate with everything.TIPS: *Nice, classy atmosphere, *Nice seating area outside  *Parking can be found by turning either way on 7th street, including in the garage attached to Rock Bottom itself (KEEP YOUR TICKET!!  BRING IT IN WITH YOU!  ROCK BOTTOM VALIDATES PARKING, SEE THE HOSTESS.)  *Stay away from the BBQ Sliders  *Great, friendly service  *Good for parties or pre-gaming before going out somewhere else

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since I've been in Rock Bottom but I was uptown for the Shriners parade on July 4th and figured this was a good place to find refreshment on a hot day.  The restaurant has limited hours right now because they are in the process of remodeling so I had to visit them after the parade instead of before.  Anyway, I started out with sampling their beers.  For a chain brewery, these aren't too bad.  The Belgian white was very refreshing and had a wheaty flavor.  The Hoppy Red ale was quite good and better than a normal red and then I moved up to the IPA which also had a smooth hoppy taste to it.  As for food, I just wanted something light so I ordered an appetizer...the Pepper Jack Chicken Nachos.  Well light isn't what I would call this.  The plate was huge and came with sides of salsa, sour cream and guacamole.   In the nachos, there were sliced onions which often seemed a bit too large.  Also the chicken was in large pieces and I think would have been better with smaller either shredded chicken or ground chicken.  The chicken was also very dry.  I'd also expect a little spice from something that had sliced jalapenos and pepper jack cheese but there wasn't any.  The salsa wasn't even spicy and it seemed like more of an italian chunky marinara sauce than a mexican salsa.  But hey the guac was good, if that's any consolation.Service-wise, I sat at the bar and both of the bartenders were friendly and helpful.  So for beer, they get a 4.  for Service, they get a 4.  But for food, they get a 2.  And this averages out to slightly better than a 3.

Reviews.Author: Scott M.
Reviews.Content: Super relaxing fun place to sit after discovery place.  Yummy shrimp and lobster tacos!  Also tried the NE clam chowder, lots of clam and ham, beware, this is not Campbell's reciepe!  I had the sampler of beers and found them all good, however the pumpkin ale was surprisingly my favorite. Our 7yo loved the chicken fingers as shirley temples. All and all, truly perfect for what we needed.

Reviews.Author: john g.
Reviews.Content: I had the beer sampler here. For $6 I got to taste 6 pretty good beers.  We had the jambalaya and it was decent. TBH, I have no clue what great jambalaya is...service was pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Dan D.
Reviews.Content: The waitress was awesome. Thanks Victory for telling us your secrets. Rock bottom is a really good chain. the difference is in the service when visiting one of these places.

Reviews.Author: Riki L.
Reviews.Content: Visited long lost family in Charlotte, and at the last minute they decided that we should go to Rock Bottom instead of another restaurant we had reservations for. I didn't argue because I wasn't the one driving and I didn't really know better. Now I wonder what the other restaurant would've been like.I was sold on Rock Bottom because my cousin said it has the best key lime cheesecake anywhere. I ordered some weird steak and shrimp combo and it was overcooked and forgettable. The martinis were decent tasting but not strong at all, and the service was dismal. The cheesecake slice was giant and I required a take-out box for it, and the next morning it was pretty tasty. So... go there for a few martinis when they're on special and get some cheesecake if that's your thing, but don't expect to get in and out of there in under two hours.

Reviews.Author: Dave C.
Reviews.Content: A very nice brewpub - a recent and extensive renovation provides great atmosphere.  Blue cheese bacon burger was excellent.  Their brews are very well balanced and enjoyable - something on tap for everyone.

Reviews.Author: Grace S.
Reviews.Content: My coworkers brought me here for my b-day lunch and the restaurant was aight.  Since it was pouring outside, the restaurant was a little dank (but then that could just be how the place normally feels).  It took awhile for the waiter to stop by and ask us for our drink orders, but amidst good company, that didn't matter much.I ordered from the holiday special menu- chicken pot pie.  The food was incredibly hot and I spent the rest of the meal washing down chicken bites with my ice water.Regardless, Rock Bottom gets an  A+ on convenience.  My client works upstairs so we did not have to walk far to get here.

Reviews.Author: Austin V.
Reviews.Content: It's spring, a warm breeze, you want to sit on a patio somewhere and have a beer, a good meal and hang out... this was the over whelming recommendation and they delivered.  I think Jennifer's review from aol was right on is stating "Rock Bottom Brewery is the Tom Hanks of Center City dining -- all-American, unassuming and very, very popular."I went with a client and this spot has a little something for everyone (even home brewed root beer for those that don't drink - an excellent selection btw).  I sampled the burger and made me question my selection, however, I had to try the fish tacos because of the way they were served.  Side note, the only item I've ever loved on the taco bell menu was the double decker tacos because of the soft and hard shells... well this is the way their fish tacos are served, only with cheese holding the blue corn shell to the soft taco wrap.  I've had better fish tacos but this is still something I'd order again.  Lunchers tend to take their time and the service is always attentive, not pushy and generally very accommodating to the diner.  If you're in uptown and want a good beer (summer wheat and stouts were excellent), some americana fair or just a good spot to bring a client, this place is a great selection.  Enjoy

Reviews.Author: Nick S.
Reviews.Content: So I ate here for lunch & it was my 1st trip to the place. If you are to head here, it seems better suited to be a dinner or late night visit.First off, this place encompasses half a city block...well not really, but it is pretty huge. We decided to sit outside on the patio, but the inside looked huge, with a large bar, 2 pool tables, & several seating areas. The place wasn't too packed, but it was after the lunch crowd hour so I'm sure we caught it at a light time.As for the menu, while very good, it's just a little heavy for a lunch menu. Maybe I ordered something a little too filling, but from what I saw on the menu, everything was more suited to the dinner crowd. If they had lunch portions, then I think this could make it a little better place to grab lunch. The food was great though & I'd definitely consider going back for dinner next time.The one thing I regret not doing was ordering one of their beers. I've heard how good some of them are & was planning on ordering a pint, but my meal was too filiing & I couldn't see myself downing anything else.I'll be back for dinner here next time, & remember to order my beer before I eat my meal.

Reviews.Author: Tim B.
Reviews.Content: We like this place for casual lunches and dinners. It's right in the heart of downtown and it's huge--lots and lots of tables, along with a huge bar and plenty of outside seating--so it's pretty convenient for all sorts of days and times. It gets pretty crowded, especially during the lunch crunch, but because of its size, you'll never really have to wait all that long. My girlfriend lives for their fish tacos, so if that's your thing, order away. I like their burgers and sandwiches--great club sandwich, good fish and chicken sandwiches, good reubens, great chicken finger sandwich. Roch Bottom features a lot of standard pub food, done up a little nicer than the options you'd find at most places. Though it's original, Rock Bottom has more of an Outback or Applebees feel than a pub. Not a bad thing. They've got a great selection of beers, many of which are, obviously, their own creations. Try 'em all. They're really good.

Reviews.Author: Claire S.
Reviews.Content: Food was AMAZING! Fresh and cooked perfectly! You could tell that everything was cooked to order, my caesar dressing was defiantly home made! Service was great as well and food was reasonably priced! Will come back again on my next trip to Charlotte!

Reviews.Author: Tom F.
Reviews.Content: I like bottom but I like there older menu better. For example I miss the sausage meatloaf vs the new turkey one they replaced it with. Doesn't wow me like the other did. They lose a star with this updated menu.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: You'll know when you've hit it.(Ba-dum crash!)

Reviews.Author: Kathy T.
Reviews.Content: This is almost directly across the street from The Fox and Hound...and suffers not a whit in comparison! Huge menu, both in food and ale. A little *too* big inside-makes for a lack of intimate conversation, but if you want to enjoy a group outing... very nice indeed. On the whole, the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Waiting times are sometimes longer than I care for...My only beef with Uptown dining is the absolute dearth of parking. This has the advantage of being across from a good-sized parking lot.

Reviews.Author: Owen H.
Reviews.Content: I have sat at the bar, house red ale, jambalaya, big chunks of chicken, shrimp, and sausage, great spicy. I have had the pulled pork with the white ale. I have had the fish tacos. I have been back over and over and over. I have a colleague who eats here 3 or 4 times a week. This place is winner winner chicken dinner.

Reviews.Author: Joy R.
Reviews.Content: Yes! Yes! Yes! If you are weak at heart...don't come here! Cause you wil experience multiple foodgasms!!! I was a fan before they changed the decor, and now it's that much better! My favorite app is the Artichoke and Crab Dip! 0_0 with the crosctini bread! OMG! Every entree has been deelish! They have it all from burgers, to salmon, to salads! All homemade...and we haven't even gotten to dessert yet (Which is also killer of course!). Seriously! Make sure a bed is near by after you waddle out of there! lol Melissa was our sever last night and she was super cute and super helpful! Great food! Great Service! Clean and Modern decor! Free parking! Descent Price! You just can't go wrong with this place! Complete and Utter Satisfaction! Guaranteed to please! Every time! ;)

Reviews.Author: Lyndsey O.
Reviews.Content: They've remodeled the inside of the restaurant and it looks great! The beer is great and the service really good. The food is overpriced. It's good food, but not worth the $$. I'd prefer to grab a beer here and eat somewhere else uptown for the money.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan U.
Reviews.Content: Had lunch here with my girlfriend and her young boys after Discovery Place.  I had the Mac and Chicken - awesome.  She had the ahi tuna salad - which she said was delicious too!  It wasn't crowded at all - service was pleasant and the boys gobbled up their buttered noodles.  I had the Rock Bottom IPA - pretty good beer.  Overall we were very happy with our experience.

Reviews.Author: Nancy D.
Reviews.Content: This place is okay. What I like is their own unique selection of beers they have to offer. Since they brew theri own on site and have many different "flavors" to choose from this makes this place above par for actual bar food fare. Their hops have a bitter taste so I wouldn't say their crafted beers are for everyone, they would best be enjoyed by IPA lovers.Their bar food menu is alright, their fish tacos are pretty good. This is a good last minute place to check out a brew a snack and catch some updates on your favorite sports on their flat screens strategically placed through out the bar.

Reviews.Author: Jasline K.
Reviews.Content: Let me just say, the5 times that I have been here, I have LOVED it!Went here for the first time with my boyfriend. We went during the week, and they had some kind of trivia going on(it was pretty fun & entertaining) For an appetizer, my boyfriend ordered a caesar salad, which was really good! I ordered chicken quesadillas which were MIND BLOWING!! I mean OMG, they were soooooo good! I had never eaten sour cream or avocado before that night, and now I eat it all the time when I get the quesadillas.  Next, my boyfriend ordered a burger(with cheese, ketcup and mustard. PLAIN I know.) He ordered steak fries that came out more like potato wedges. He thought his burger was so-so. I tasted it, and it was dry and overcooked. The wedges were salty as well. I ordered a steak(medium well) and fries. Now that was 10 times better than my boyfriends plain burger. My steak was juicy, seasoned well, and cooked to perfection. I couldn't have asked for a better steak! So kudos to the cook! My fries were normal fries which were just as tasty(once again better than my boyfriends) lol.I have been back to Rock Bottom 4 times since then, and now that I live up the street from it, I plan on becoming a weekly regular! I always get the chicken quesadillas, and have even tried the chicken nachos. Let me tell you that the nachos coming in a heap PILED up on a plate, with cheese, olives, tomatoes, and other stuff. They were sooooo good! Me and my friends couldn't eat it all.Also, my boyfriend ordered the ribs before, and he did not like them WHAT-SO-EVER. But then again, he was comparing them to the ribs at Firebirds so yea. He also ordered the cheese pizza, and I must say that I have gotten better pizza at chuckie-cheese. I don't know if my boyfriend just has a string of bad luck at ordering at Rock Bottom, but his food is NEVER as good as mines. I have ordered the burger before(cheese, ketchup, mustard, lettuce, bbq sauce, medium well) and it was DELISH!I recommend Rock Bottom to everyone to try out for themselves!

Reviews.Author: Corbin N.
Reviews.Content: Been to Rock bottom multiple times, just as always had a great time. Our server was Donna, great server and she knew a lot about the beers.The manager was walking around checking in on tables so I asked him for his suggestion from the menu. He suggested the Chicken Parmesan pasta with the "Smoky Mountain" pasta sauce and a side of marinara.It. was. amazing. Perfect recommendation. Had a great time. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Patricia D.
Reviews.Content: yumm yumm yumm... Rock Bottom has some great food and the atmosphere is really cool. I love the fact that you can view the brewery and the beer sampler was fantastic! I don't have one bad thing to say about this place. Every one was very nice, they gave us time to actually enjoy our appetizer before our entrees came, and the food tasted absoutely amazing! I will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Kate G.
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and prompt, but the food is clearly made in some massive off site kitchen and then frozen and shipped (unfortunately, most restaurants are doing this nowadays). This is basically a glorified Applebees, but if you need a place to get a beer and some simple appetizers, or if you love fat and salt, a good bet. They do have a good beer selection and sitting at the bar can be interesting, but every bar is interesting.

Reviews.Author: Jenn E.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't impressed with this place. The menu sounds really great& the waitress suggested I get the chicken bacon Mac & cheese, but it was disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Author: Starry r.
Reviews.Content: Go here if you enjoy waiting in the lobby when there are tons of open tables and being rudely treated by the hostess!  The food is just ok bar food.  The beer is awesome I will admit and the servers are pretty attentive.  I would rather drive down to Myrtle beach or Atlanta to it's sister restaurant Gordon Biersch.  The food is much better and the people who work there will treat you much better.  If you really need to go there to enjoy the beer, I'd eat elsewhere and then just sit at the bar.

Reviews.Author: Terri B.
Reviews.Content: Looking for the perfect Mojito???  Well look no further!    Rock Bottom has by far the tastiest Pinapple Mojitos.   I stop by Rock Bottom atleast once each time I am in the Charlotte area.    What brings me here? The mojitos and the apple bread pudding.  The steaks, wings, shrimp are good -- but not the reason that keeps me coming back.  Note:  You can park in the parking garage and get your ticket validated for 2 hours of free parking.

Reviews.Author: Hungry C.
Reviews.Content: 57 dollars for two steak meals and plenty of beer is not a bad price at all. Being in the center of downtown you would think there prices would be higher but they have some amazing choices and beers for a good price. I enjoyed there red ale more then there brown but both where great and my wife said that her kolsch was well made also. Ive been here several times and will be returning several more.

Reviews.Author: Alessandra S.
Reviews.Content: Ate here the other night and would TOTALLY go back. Very spacious, awesome bar and outdoor seating available. I had the Hawaiin Chicken dish - you have to try this, it was incredible! They chicken was so juicy and cooked perfectly, with pineapple sauce on top and rice pilaf underneath. I am craving it again as I type this. It is also very cool to walk into a place and order your beer by saying "red, ale, amber, port" etc. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Prasad T.
Reviews.Content: Good beer, tried their Rock bottom IPA

Reviews.Author: Amith G.
Reviews.Content: I tried all their beers; the seasonal was OK, stout was great.  Rest of them were not good IMO.  Food is so so - not really worthy of 3 stars and wait time was long but it was a Saturday prom evening so it's OK.  They got the third star from me for the service; waitress was great and once seated, service was extremely prompt and courteous.  I guess they made it a point to train their staff in explaining their different brews so that was nice.

Reviews.Author: Jenna M.
Reviews.Content: Checked this place out while on vacation. They had pretty decent food but the atmosphere was very chain restaurant like. But great beer!

Reviews.Author: Sarah H.
Reviews.Content: This place has a fantastic outdoor patio and makes for a great place to sip back and enjoy a few beers. We split the brewer's feast and particularly enjoyed the southwest egg rolls with a roasted jalapeno ranch dressing. I enjoyed their winter seasonal and their Sweet Magnolia brown ale. However, they didn't make my top favorite beer selection and other than that I really didn't find any of their brews to be that great. Overall, I'd recommend going elsewhere with a better beer selection from multiple breweries. Of course, much of this review reflects my distaste for chain restaurants and breweries.

Reviews.Author: Isabel Y.
Reviews.Content: Great location in Uptown. Awesome to sit outside and people watch. The menu at any Rock Bottom is semi boring, but if you just want food one step up from Friday's (read: just order a burger and you'll be happy), then this place is good. Fun for after Alive After Five downtown. The bathrooms at this place are pretty cool-- you get to see all the brewery things in the back. Even though it's a large restaurant, I'd try to make a reservation or at least call ahead if you know you are coming-- sometimes the wait here gets just a little north of uncomfortably long.

Reviews.Author: Andrew H.
Reviews.Content: Great Place, great beer and the Fish Tacos are kick ass!!!

Reviews.Author: Courtney N.
Reviews.Content: Beer is good, strawberry margarita is delicious!! The jalapeño pretzel bites are an appetizer worth paying for!! Wish it wasn't just seasonal, they should have it all year round! Food was so yummy! Our server Brittany was so nice and helpful! Definitely a place I would visit again :)

Reviews.Author: Joel w.
Reviews.Content: not thrilling, not disappointing.  RB is average across the board.  Try the Hazelnut Crusted Chicken.

Reviews.Author: Shannon C.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delicious! Ordered cherry glazed, hazelnut-crusted chicken. The vegs? They didn't overcook carrots! Yay! My teen ordered avocado chicken sandwich - it's BIG and avocado, were ripe and fresh! Nice service! Go. I almost died there... so was my teenager daughter (she was picky but she loved her order very much).

Reviews.Author: Nicole T.
Reviews.Content: I've visited Rock bottom many times, but recently went after the remodel. The restaurant looks much better. I ordered the southwest turkey burger (awesome) and my husband ordered the chicken tacos (awesome)! The service was superb! I think the remodel improved the dining experience.

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: great food and great atmosphere

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Typical sports bar. Caught the tail end of happy hour. I got the Rocktoberfest seasonal ale and that was pretty good. But i ordered a side of fries to munch on and it was incredibly tiny :(

Reviews.Author: Chris S.
